topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the KVM Region Custom Patch

body.p: If you did not deploy the KVM Region Custom Patch, TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0001.patch during installation, perform the following steps.

You should have downloaded the following patch files during the prerequisites. The patch is in a compressed file called HCG2.0_WR001_Patch001.tar.gz. The README with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.
Note: You can use the Horizon UI to see if the patch has been deployed. Select the regionkvm, then click Admin, then System, and Inventory. Click the Patches table.
This patch addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.
body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
body.p: First log into the active cotroller, patch the standby controller, then make the standby active.
The following steps assume that controller-0 is active and controller-1 is standby.

ol.li: SSH into active controller in the KVM region. For example: controller-0
Create a directory for the patch:mkdir -p /tmp/patches

Copy the following patch file to the /tmp/patches directory:
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0001.patch
You should have downloaded this patch file in the Prerequisites.
Execute the following commands: sudo sw-patch upload /tmp/patches/TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0001.patch sudo sw-patch apply TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0001.patch source /etc/nova/openrc

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-1 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-1

Execute the following command to switch the active controller from the specifed controller: system host-swact controller-#
For example, switch the active controller from controller-0 to controller-1:system host-swact controller-0

body.p: Now, log onto the newly active controller and patch the standby controller.

ol.li: SSH into the newly active controller. For example: controller-1.

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-0 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-0

body.p: From the active controller, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Execute the following command to lock compute-0:system host-lock compute-0 If this fails, perform a force lock:system host-lock --force compute-0
Execute the following command to patch and reboot compute-0: system host-patch-reboot compute-0
Execute the following command to unlock compute-0:system host-unlock compute-0
Execute the following command to lock compute-1:system host-lock compute-1 If this fails, perform a force lock:system host-lock --force compute-1
Execute the following command to patch and reboot compute-1: system host-patch-reboot compute-1
Execute the following command to unlock compute-1:system host-unlock compute-1
